title: EE 4OI6 Course Information
content:

Important Dates

  • Form Groups: Group List for C02 (All meetings in ITB/A224). Meeting Schedule for C02 (Alternating Week 1/2 starting Sept. 28, 2015). Please report any problems to TA Warren Pawlikowski.
  • Project Proposal: Presentations during the week of October 19th in ABB/164 (Presentation Schedule). Reports due Oct. 26th by 4pm to TA Warren Pawlikowski in ITB/239.
  • Milestone Demo 1: Week of November 30, 2015 (presentation schedule).
  • Milestone Demo 2: Week of February 22, 2016 (presentation schedule).
  • Final Demonstrations: April 6 and 7, 2016 (schedule). Download final report guidelines.
  • ECE Expo: April 8, 2016, CIBC Hall, MUSC. Download final report guidelines.
  • Final Report: April 11, 2016 before 4pm to TA. Download final report guidelines.

Course Outline

  • Project Guidelines
  • Optional Lab Assignments
  • Policy Reminders:

Discrimination and Harassment: Contact the Department Chair, the Sexual Harassment Officer, or the Human Rights Consultant if unresolved issues arise.

  • Academic Integrity:

Responsibilities: Understand and comply with the Academic Integrity Policy.

Consequences: Academic dishonesty can lead to serious consequences such as a grade of zero, loss of credit, suspension, or expulsion.

Examples of Academic Dishonesty: Plagiarism, improper collaboration, and using unauthorized aids in tests and examinations.

  • Resources:

Statement on Academic Ethics and Senate Resolutions on Academic Dishonesty: Available at registration and in the Senate Office.

Academic Integrity Policy: Academic Integrity Policy
